data.event: The town was built in the early 60s, around the Ranipur plant of Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL) part of Nehruvian dream of "temples of modern India".
In an important move in 1962, Indian signed an agreement with the Soviet Union for the supply of Rs.
In 1999, the Ranipur plant, reached a turnover of Rs 1100 crore, which reached Rs 2,658 crore for the year 2007-08.

event.title: Today BHEL, is one of India's seven largest Public Sector Undertakings or PSUs, known

data.event: Today BHEL, is one of India's seven largest Public Sector Undertakings or PSUs, known as the Maharatnas or 'the seven jewels'.
